Title: Scarab with Pseudo-text
Medium: light brown steatite with blue-green glaze, gold leaf, and linen
Inscriptions: [Inscription] The inscription provides no clear context; the producer just copied words and signs. Some signs have no real comparison in Egyptian script (such as the baboon-headed animal with the tail of the god Seth or the short how-signs at the right and left edge of the lowest line), and others are reversed or upside down. There are also no obvious parallels to enigmatic texts or cryptographic writings.
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1924, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
